description: Borrowed from Latin positus, perfect participle of pōnō (“put, place”).

entries.meaning: Something that is posited; a postulate.

verbs.description: posit (third-person singular simple present posits, present participle positing, simple past and past participle posited)

entries.meaning: Assume the existence of; to postulate.
examples: some who posit both this cause and besides this the source of movement, which we have got from some as single and from other as twofold.

entries.meaning: Propose for consideration or study; to suggest.
Put (something somewhere) firmly; to place or position.
